newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Indian, Pakistan start new round of talks.
newsitem.headline: Indian, Pakistan start new round of talks.

text.p: Indian and Pakistani foreign ministry officials began a new round of talks on Friday, resuming a dialogue which the archrivals launched in March.

"We are going in with a positive spirit and a positive approach," Indian foreign secretary Salman Haider told reporters as he arrived at Punjab House where he was greeted warmly by his Pakistani counterpart Shamshad Ahmad.
Ahmad put his arm around Haider as the delegations walked inside to start the talks, which are scheduled to continue until Monday.

"Our immediate task is to ... focus on the modalities, methodology and structure of dialogue," Haider told reporters at Islamabad airport on Thursday night. "The agenda is to continue our discussions of which we already had one round in Delhi."
Ahmad made clear that Pakistan wanted to place the Kashmir dispute, which has caused two of the three wars fought with India since independence in 1947, high on the agenda.
"It is our earnest desire, and it will be our endeavour, to focus on this issue as part of our overall attempt to find a peaceful solution of all problems that face us, he said.
